titles.title: Zǝmmare, Eucharistic hymns / Mäwaśǝʾt, Antiphonary for feasts and funeral service

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Zǝmmare, Eucharistic hymns (fols. 3ra-64vc) II) Mäwaśǝʾt, Antiphonary for feasts and funeral service (fols. 66ra-94ra)
Additio 1.

txstates.txstate: The back board is split. The back board attachment is damaged at the 1st station. The upper edge of the textblock is damaged by rodents. The upper and bottom parts of the spine protection are damaged. Some fols. are stained with wax and water. In the centrefold of quire A, a leaf of irregular size (left - stub, right - very narrow leaf) has been used.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the back board is split). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible in the centre fold of the quires, one close to the head and one close to the tail of the codex. Spine protection made of parchment.

inks.ink: Black, red (fols. 3ra-22vc, 66ra-94ra: vivid red; fols. 23ra-64v: deep reddish-brown)

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – ፩I(10/fols. 3r-12v) – ፪II(10/fols. 13r-22v) – ፫III(10/fols. 23r-32v) – ፬IV(10/fols. 33r-42v) – ፭V(10/fols. 43r-52v) – ፯VI(10/fols. 53r-62v) – VII(3; s.l.: 2, stub after 2/fols. 63r-65v) – ፩VIII(10/fols. 66r-75v) – ፪IX(11; s.l.: 2, stub after 10/fols. 76r-86v) – [፫]X(9; s.l.: 2, stub after 8/fols. 87r-95v) – B(1; s.l.: 1, stub before 1 of quire A/fols. 96r-v). The last leaf (quire B) embracing the textblock is used is used as the spine protection. The stub of the leaf is visible between the front board and fol. 1.

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks (occasionally of slit-type) are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling. The upper line is written below the ruling: fols. 22r, 32rab, 61rv. The upper ruled line was not used by the scribe on fol. 3r. The ruling is disregarded: text is written between or on the lines: e.g., fols. 27r, 29r, 54r, 60r, 61v. On some fols. the ruling pricks are placed close to the outer edge: e.g., fols. 14, 37, 50, 54, 63.

Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks (occasionally of slit-type) are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: mediocre; hand b: mediocre

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: fols. 3ra-93vc Hand b: fols. 93vb-94ra, omitted words and passages, corrections (s. Varia)

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; musical notation signs or their elements in the margin; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals. Text I: Two groups of lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Texts I and II; names of sections (zǝmmare) followed by feast or day names and occasionally preceded by the date; names of subsections and their abbreviations (ḫǝbǝst, mänfäs, ṣǝwwaʿ) occasionally followed by feast names; names of antiphons on fol. 33vb; versicles which are to be repeated and their abbreviations (e.g., ḫaylä mäläkotu and its abbreviations ḫa, ḫay on fol. 4vab). Text II: Names of antiphons (mäwaśǝʾt) followed by feast or day names; elements of the numbers of psalms; names of sections of antiphons and their abbreviations (mǝlṭan); the words yǝbarǝkǝwwo, ṣälot, sǝbḥǝwwo and their abbreviations.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ዝ፡/ዝማ፡ for ዝማሬ፡ መ፡/መን፡/መንፈ፡ for መንፈስ፡ ጽ፡/ጽዋ፡ for ጽዋዕ፡ ም፡/ምል፡/ምልጣ: for ምልጣን፡ ይባር፡ for ይባርክዎ፡ ዕዝ፡ for ዕዝል፡ ጸሎ፡ for ጸሎት፡ ስብ፡/ስብሕ፡ for ስብሕዎ፡

otherdetails.otherdetail: - A portion of Mäwaśǝʾt dedicated to St. Mary (Mäwaśǝʾt zä-ʾǝgzǝʾtǝnä Maryam), omitted in the main text, has been written at the end of Text II (fols. 93vc-94ra), in hand b. It should be inserted into fol. 89va l.1 before the part beginning with “ʿǝzl”. - The quires are numbered separately for Texts I and II. Quire number 6 is skipped (Text I).

additional.cont: Fol. 1r: Unidentified excerpt from a liturgical chant for Sunday (sänbät).
additional.det: The excerpt is written in a mediocre hand.

extras.extra: - Tämälläs-signs, in the shape of a cross and two perpendicular lines, indicating the place where the omissions, written in the margins, in hand b, belong: fols. 3vb l.1, 11ra l.2, 18vb l.9, 19rc l.14, 41rb l.7, 46rc l.19, 63rb l.27, 74vc l.8, 76rc l.22, 78ra l.10, 83rc l.1, 84vb l.7, 88ra l.9. - Omissions written interlineally and in the margins, in hand b: fols. 4r, 14vbc, 30va, 43rc, 56ra, 60v, 66ra, 70rb, 73r, 73v, 76vab, 80rbc, 83rb, 85rbc, 86rbc, 87ra, 88vbc, 89rac, 89vc, 91v, 92ra, 92va, 93va. - Corrections over erasure, in hand b: fols. 4rb, 6vb, 8vbc, 12vb, 15va, 31vb, 32rac, 41rc, 63vc, 71rb, 77va, 85vc, 87ra. - Immediate correction indicated by thin lines above and below the word: fols. 20vb, 21rb, 22rb, 22vc, 25rc, 63rb, 64ra. - Small crosses are drawn in the margins of Text I: e.g., fols. 4r, 18r, 30r, 33r, 45v, 46r. - A straight line, parallel to the ruled lines, is drawn in the upper margin of fols. 33r-42v, 46r, 49r. - A line of a text has been erased in the upper margin: fols. 8r, 56v, 59v, 86vc, 91v. - A few lines of a text have been erased on fols. 64vc and 93vb. - Pen trial: fols. 33r, 82r, 86v. - Scribbles: fol. 64vc.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: Undecorated quire marks are written in the left upper margin in the first fol. of the quire: fols. 3r, 13r, 23r, 33r, 43r, 53r, 66r, 76r.

frames.frame: Fol. 66r (incipit of Text II): elaborate, coloured (red, black) ornamental band; interlaces. Fol. 93vb: small, coloured (red, black) ornamental band; interlaces.
